DataElement.preferredDefinition: Dictionary code denoting the fourth level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System Level Four
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._A World Health Organization (WHO) classification system for medicinal substances where active substances are divided into different groups according to the organ or system on which they act and their therapeutic, pharmacological, and chemical properties. Drugs are classified in groups at five different levels._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.
